results.definition: put an end to a state or an activity
an obstruction in a pipe or tube
the act of stopping something
examples: the third baseman made some remarkable stops
his stoppage of the flow resulted in a flood

results.definition: prevent completion
the state of inactivity following an interruption
examples: he spent the entire stop in his seat

results.definition: stop from happening or developing
render unsuitable for passage
a restraint that checks the motion of something
examples: he used a book as a stop to hold the door open

results.definition: have an end, in a temporal, spatial, or quantitative sense; either spatial or metaphorical
examples: Your rights stop where you infringe upon the rights of other

results.definition: stop and wait, as if awaiting further instructions or developments
interrupt a trip
examples: we stopped at Aunt Mary's house
they stopped for three days in Florence

results.definition: seize on its way
a mechanical device in a camera that controls size of aperture of the lens
a consonant produced by stopping the flow of air at some point and suddenly releasing it
examples: his stop consonants are too aspirated

results.definition: come to a halt, stop moving
examples: She stopped in front of a store window

results.definition: the event of something ending
examples: it came to a stop at the bottom of the hill

results.definition: a brief stay in the course of a journey
examples: they made a stopover to visit their friends

results.definition: a punctuation mark (.) placed at the end of a declarative sentence to indicate a full stop or after abbreviations
examples: in England they call a period a stop

results.definition: hold back, as of a danger or an enemy; check the expansion or influence of
a spot where something halts or pauses
cause to stop
(music) a knob on an organ that is pulled to change the sound quality from the organ pipes
examples: the organist pulled out all the stops
